meanings.definition: A carbohydrate containing a small number of monosaccharide units linked together.
meanings.sent1: The nutritionist explained that oligosaccharides are carbohydrates made up of a few sugar units.
meanings.sent2: Many fruits and vegetables contain oligosaccharides, which are short chains of sugar molecules.
meanings.sent3: The chef joked that the secret to his delicious soup was adding a pinch of oligosaccharides for extra sweetness.
meanings.sent4: In the recipe of success, oligosaccharides act as the binding agents that hold everything together.
meanings.sent5: Under the microscope, oligosaccharides look like tiny sugar beads strung together in a chain.

meanings.definition: Short chains of sugar molecules found in various foods.
meanings.sent1: When you eat whole grains, your body breaks down oligosaccharides into simpler sugars for energy.
meanings.sent2: Nutrition labels often list oligosaccharides as a type of carbohydrate present in the food.
meanings.sent3: The children giggled as they learned that oligosaccharides are like the sweet little cousins of sugar molecules.
meanings.sent4: In the garden of nutrition, oligosaccharides are the small, interconnected sugar vines that nourish the body.
meanings.sent5: During digestion, oligosaccharides play a crucial role in providing a slow release of energy throughout the day.
